review: It's a very wonderful islamic app which has both Quran, translations,tejweed, and many other i suggest you install this app
response_1:
Assalamu Alaikum wa Rahmatullahi wa Barakatuh. JazakAllahu Khair for sharing your kind words about the app; we are delighted to hear that you find it wonderful and helpful for your Qur’an study. Your encouragement inspires us to continue serving the Ummah with humility and sincere effort.  

For the details you asked about: you can view over 90 translation languages (including English, Bangla, Urdu, German, Indonesian, Turkish, and many more) by tapping **Settings → Languages**; audio recitations from more than 50 renowned reciters are available, and you may download any Surah or the whole Qur’an for offline listening via the **Download** icon. Tajweed display can be customized in **Mushaf Mode**—adjust font size, line spacing, and choose the preferred script. Beyond translations and recitations, the app offers a Quran Planner, topic explorer, word‑by‑word analysis, badges, and a library for notes and bookmarks, all of which can be used offline after downloading the needed resources. Should you have further suggestions or need assistance, please submit them at **feedback.gtaf.org** so we can track and address them promptly. May Allah accept our efforts and bless you in your continued worship. BarakAllahu feekum.

review: Very good for understanding Quran
response_1:
Assalamu Alaikum wa Rahmatullahi wa Barakatuh. JazakAllahu Khair for sharing your wonderful experience that the app is “very good for understanding the Qur’an.” It warms our hearts to hear that the tools we provide are aiding you in drawing closer to the words of Allah, and we are grateful for your kind words.  

If you wish to deepen your study even further, you might try these simple steps:  
1. Open the **Qur’an Planner** from the menu and set a daily reading goal that fits your schedule.  
2. While reading, tap any ayah to view **word‑by‑word translations, tafsīr (e.g., Ibn Kathīr), or the “Gharīb” notes** for deeper meanings.  
3. Enable **audio recitation** (choose a beloved qāriʾ such as Mishary Al‑Afasy) and use the repeat function to reinforce memorization.  

Your enthusiasm reflects the noble purpose of our service—khidmah to the Ummah by facilitating easy access to Qur’anic knowledge and worship. May Allah accept your efforts, increase you in understanding, and keep you steadfast on the path of ibādah. BarakAllahu feekum, and may Allah accept from you and us.

review: I love that they added the dictionary
response_1:
Assalamu Alaikum wa Rahmatullahi wa Barakatuh. JazakAllahu Khair for sharing your delight with the newly added dictionary – it is truly heart‑warming to hear that this tool is benefiting you in your Qur’anic study and Arabic learning. May Allah reward you for seeking knowledge, for it is a noble service (khidmah) to the Ummah.  

To make the most of the dictionary:  
1. Open the app and tap the **Library** icon, then select **Dictionary**.  
2. Choose your desired language pair (e.g., Arabic‑English, Arabic‑Urdu, etc.) from the list at the top.  
3. You may download the dictionary for offline use by tapping the **download** icon next to the pair.  
4. Each entry provides meanings, example sentences, and brief usage tips to help you apply the word correctly.  
5. The dictionary is updated automatically with new words when you update the app via the Play Store or App Store.  

We are grateful for your feedback and invite you to share any further suggestions at **feedback.gtaf.org**, so we can continue to enhance this service for all believers. May Allah accept our efforts and grant you ease in your learning. BarakAllahu feekum.

review: High performance quality Good more options Bookmarks are needed to be more easyer
response_1:
Assalamu Alaikum wa Rahmatullahi wa Barakatuh. JazakAllahu Khair for sharing your experience with the app. We are delighted to hear that you find the performance quality high and that the app serves you well in your Qur’an study. At the same time, we understand your concern that the bookmark feature could be made easier to use, and we appreciate your honesty in pointing this out.  

To simplify bookmarking, you can long‑press any ayah to add it directly to a “Collection” in the Library, which functions as a set of bookmarks you can rename and organize later. If you prefer a quicker tap, try the star icon that appears at the top‑right of the screen while reading; this adds the ayah to your default bookmark list. For any further ideas on making this process smoother—such as a dedicated “Quick Bookmark” button—please submit your suggestions at feedback.gtaf.org so our development team can consider them. Your feedback helps us serve the Ummah better and fulfill the noble purpose of facilitating easy access to the Qur’an.  

May Allah accept our efforts and bless you in your worship. BarakAllahu feekum.

review: The challenge with the app are the multiple daily reminders - they just don't switch off

To turn off or adjust the daily reminders, please open the app, tap **Settings** (gear icon), select **Reminders**, and toggle the switch off or set a preferred time/frequency. If the reminders still appear, you can also check your device’s notification settings: on Android, go to **Settings → Apps → [App Name] → Notifications** and disable “Reminders”; on iOS, go to **Settings → Notifications → [App Name]** and turn off “Reminders”. Should you need further assistance or wish to suggest additional reminder options, kindly submit your feedback at **feedback.gtaf.org** so we can track it properly.

review: Great Apps if this provide another khat beside uthmani, such as indonesia khat.
response_1:
Assalamu Alaikum wa Rahmatullahi wa Barakatuh. JazakAllahu Khair for sharing your positive experience with the app and for your thoughtful suggestion to include an Indonesian khat alongside the Uthmani script. We truly appreciate your desire to see the Qur’an presented in a style that resonates with the Indonesian‑speaking Ummah, and we understand how such an option could enhance your reading and recitation experience.  

To help us consider this addition, please submit your detailed request through our feedback portal at **feedback.gtaf.org**. Our development team reviews all submissions and will evaluate the feasibility of adding an Indonesian khat, as well as options for easy switching and font‑size adjustments. May Allah reward you for your contribution to improving this service to the Ummah. BarakAllahu feekum, and may Allah accept from you and us.

review: Probably the best Qur'an App I've ever used. Great and resourceful.
response_1:
Assalamu Alaikum wa Rahmatullahi wa Barakatuh. JazakAllahu Khair for sharing your wonderful experience with the app; it warms our hearts to hear that you consider it the best Qur’an app you have used. Your kind words encourage us to continue serving the Ummah with humility and sincerity.

If you wish to explore even more blessings, you may try the Quran Planner to set personalized reading goals, or tap the Mushaf mode for a classic page‑by‑page experience while keeping your favorite reciter ready. Should you have any ideas for new resources or features, please let us know by submitting feedback at **feedback.gtaf.org**, so we can keep improving this Khidmah for all believers. May Allah accept our efforts and grant you ease in your ibādah. BarakAllahu feekum.

review: One of the best Quran learning apps.
response_1:
Assalamu Alaikum wa Rahmatullahi wa Barakatuh. JazakAllahu Khair for sharing your kind words about the app; it warms our hearts to hear that you consider it one of the best Quran learning tools. Al‑hamdulillah, we are grateful that the features—such as the diverse recitations, tafsir, and planning tools—are serving you well in your journey of ibādah.  

If you have a moment, we would love for you to explore additional resources like the interactive quizzes, topic‑based collections, or the new audio translations we are continuously adding, to further enrich your study. Should you wish to suggest any improvements or share more detailed feedback, please submit it at feedback.gtaf.org so we can continue serving the Ummah with the best possible experience. May Allah accept your efforts and bless your learning. BarakAllahu feekum.
